DataElement.preferredName: Autonomic Neuropathy Confirmed New Involvement Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there was new evidence of autonomic neuropathy involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An inherited or acquired peripheral neuropathy affecting the autonomic nervous system. It results in disruption of the involuntary body functions. Inherited causes include Fabry disease and porphyrias. Acquired causes include diabetes, uremia, hepatic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, toxins, and drug toxicities._Having been established or verified._Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An inherited or acquired peripheral neuropathy affecting the autonomic nervous system. It results in disruption of the involuntary body functions. Inherited causes include Fabry disease and porphyrias. Acquired causes include diabetes, uremia, hepatic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, toxins, and drug toxicities.

Concepts.definition: An inherited or acquired peripheral neuropathy affecting the autonomic nervous system. It results in disruption of the involuntary body functions. Inherited causes include Fabry disease and porphyrias. Acquired causes include diabetes, uremia, hepatic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, toxins, and drug toxicities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Confirmed; having been established or verified.:New; having no previous example or precedent or parallel.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
